intro: Metrosideros collina var. oahuensis, commonly known as the Oahu coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its bright red or orange-red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules containing seeds. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in other regions with a tropical climate.
